alert.note: Alert for Butler; Harvey; Marion; Sedgwick (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 14 at 9:56PM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Sedgwick, eastern Harvey, northwestern Butler and Marion Counties through 1100 PM CDT... At 955 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles northwest of Gypsum to near Galva to near Hesston to Halstead to Andale. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Newton, Park City, Valley Center, Hesston, Hillsboro, Marion, North Newton, Sedgwick, Peabody, Whitewater, Florence, Goessel, Walton, Elbing, Lincolnville, Ramona, Lehigh, Durham, Tampa and Lost Springs. This includes Interstate 135 between Mile Markers 17 and 37. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for south central and central Kansas.
